stages.title: Define Your History & Literature Vision
stages.description: Clarify your interests in history, literature, comparative literature, or cultural studies, and identify target universities.

Global.overview: Top history and literature programs value strong reading, writing, analytical skills, and clear specialization interests.
checklist: Research 5-7 top programs (Harvard, Oxford, Cambridge, Yale, UCL)
Identify your interest (history, literature, comparative literature, cultural studies)
Assess your reading, writing, and analytical preparation
Create a 3-year roadmap connecting research, academics, and applications

US.overview: US programs emphasize strong academics, writing, and research experience.
checklist: Research reach, target, and safety schools
Note AP History and English requirements
Plan your Common App personal statement theme

UK.overview: UK programs prioritize A-levels, HAT/ELAT, and strong personal statements.
checklist: Review entry requirements for Oxford, Cambridge, etc.
Start HAT (History) or ELAT (Literature) preparation if required

Asia.overview: Bridge national curricula with global standards.
checklist: Review history/literature topics in national exams

quiz.q: What do top history/literature programs value most?
opts: Strong reading + writing + analytical thinking + research
quiz.correct: Strong reading + writing + analytical thinking + research

stages.title: Build Research & Writing Skills
stages.description: Develop research, writing, and analytical skills through historical or literary research projects.

Global.overview: Demonstrate history/literature ability through research, writing, and analytical work.
checklist: Conduct independent research on historical or literary topic
Participate in history or literature competitions
Read extensively in your area of interest
projectIdeas: Create a literary analysis blog or podcast
Participate in history or literature competitions
Organize a reading group or book club

US.overview: Link research to applications and programs.
checklist: Submit research to competitions or journals

UK.overview: Integrate research into EPQ or UCAS.
checklist: Draft EPQ proposal on history/literature topic

quiz.q: What's the best way to demonstrate history/literature skills?

stages.title: Strengthen Academic Foundation
stages.description: Excel in history, English, and humanities coursework.

Global.overview: Strong reading, writing, and analytical preparation is essential.
checklist: Master critical reading and analytical writing
Read primary sources and literary works
Complete AP US History, World History, or English Literature
Read widely in history and literature
Achieve A* in A-level History and English

quiz.q: What academic areas are most critical for history/literature?
opts: Reading, writing, analytical thinking, and extensive knowledge
quiz.correct: Reading, writing, analytical thinking, and extensive knowledge

stages.title: Craft Your History/Literature Narrative
stages.description: Translate your research, writing, and achievements into compelling applications.

Global.overview: Connect your history/literature passion and achievements.
checklist: Connect to historical or literary themes
Get feedback from teachers or mentors
Draft Common App essay with history/literature focus
Prepare statements for UCAS and Common App
Draft reflection on history/literature career goals

quiz.q: What should your history/literature statement highlight?
opts: Analytical thinking, research, and passion for history/literature
quiz.correct: Analytical thinking, research, and passion for history/literature

stages.title: Final Preparation & Interviews
stages.description: Polish applications and prepare for interviews.

checklist: Prepare to discuss research and reading

opts: Clear analysis, knowledge of texts/history, and critical thinking
quiz.correct: Clear analysis, knowledge of texts/history, and critical thinking
